titleStmt.title: Moro-mastix: Mr Iohn Goodwin whipt with his own rod. Or The dis-secting of the sixteenth section of his book truly nam'd by himself Hagio-Mastix: so far as it falsly and frivolously mentions a late disputation in Christ-Church-Parish, concerning the lawfulness of paying tythes. / By a diligent observer of the said disputation.
titleStmt.author: A Diligent Observer of the Said Disputation.

titleStmt.title: Moro-mastix: Mr Iohn Goodwin whipt with his own rod. Or The dis-secting of the sixteenth section of his book truly nam'd by himself Hagio-Mastix: so far as it falsly and frivolously mentions a late disputation in Christ-Church-Parish, concerning the lawfulness of paying tythes. / By a diligent observer of the said disputation.
titleStmt.author: A Diligent Observer of the Said Disputation.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Tho. Underhill, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Bible in great Woodstreet,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 8[?] 1646"; the 7 in imprint date crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: Diligent Observer of the Said Disputation.
